inhibits O
the O
simultaneous O
condensation O
of O
both O
. O

section 5
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/26-08-2019-paper-2.pdf.json
A O
third O
distortion O
of O
symmetry O
X+5 O
associated O
to O
deformations O
of O
the O
MX6 O
octahedra O
must O
be O
taken O
into O
account O
to O
justify O
the O
existence O
of O
a O
monoclinic O
ground O
state O
. O

section 5
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/26-08-2019-paper-2.pdf.json
Although O
the O
stiffness O
constant O
of O
the O
third O
mode O
is O
positive O
, O
a O
strong O
trilinear O
coupling O
among O
the O
three O
modes O
is O
the O
ultimate O
cause O
of O
the O
stabilization O
of O
the O
observed O
ground O
state O
. O

section 5
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/26-08-2019-paper-2.pdf.json
This O
mechanism O
has O
been O
already O
observed O
in O
several O
ferroelectrics O
, O
and O
present O
results O
suggest O
that O
the O
presence O
and O
relevance O
of O
a O
trilinear O
coupling O
could O
be O
almost O
universal O
when O
the O
symmetry O
breaking O
at O
the O
phase O
transition O
involves O
several O
modes O
. O

section 5
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/26-08-2019-paper-2.pdf.json
A O
phenomenological O
approach O
in O
terms O
of O
the O
chemical O
pressure O
associated O
to O
the O
change O
of O
the O
radius O
of O
the O
M O
cation O
shows O
a O
very O
accurate O
linear O
behavior O
of O
the O
quadratic O
terms O
of O
the O
Landau O
expansion O
with O
respect O
to O
the O
chemical O
pressure O
, O
while O
higher O
- O
order O
terms O
remain O
essentially O
constant O
. O

section 5
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/26-08-2019-paper-2.pdf.json
Finally O
, O
the O
inclusion O
of O
quantum O
corrections O
in O
the O
model O
reveals O
that O
quantum O
effects O
can O
be O
responsible O
of O
the O
stabilization O
of O
the O
monoclinic O
phase O
in O
the O
case O
of O
Sr2MgWO6 O
, O
solving O
the O
discrepancy O
with O
the O
experimental O
phase O
diagram O
. O

id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/09-02-2020-1210.8215v1.Empirical_tight_binding_parameters_for_GaAs_and_MgO_with_explicit_basis_through_DFT_mapping.pdf.json

binding O
parameters O
for O
GaAs B-MATERIAL
and I-MATERIAL

with O
explicit O
basis O

DFT O

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/09-02-2020-1210.8215v1.Empirical_tight_binding_parameters_for_GaAs_and_MgO_with_explicit_basis_through_DFT_mapping.pdf.json
The O
Empirical O
Tight O
Binding O
( O
ETB O
) O
method O
is O
widely O
used O
in O
atomistic O
device O
simulations O
. O

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/09-02-2020-1210.8215v1.Empirical_tight_binding_parameters_for_GaAs_and_MgO_with_explicit_basis_through_DFT_mapping.pdf.json
The O
reliability O
of O
such O
simulations O
depends O
very O
strongly O
on O
the O
choice O
of O
basis O
sets O
and O
the O
ETB O
parameters O
. O

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/09-02-2020-1210.8215v1.Empirical_tight_binding_parameters_for_GaAs_and_MgO_with_explicit_basis_through_DFT_mapping.pdf.json
The O
traditional O
way O
of O
obtaining O
the O
ETB O
parameters O
is O
by O
fitting O
to O
experiment O
data O
, O
or O
critical O
theoretical O
bandedges O
and O
symmetries O
rather O
than O
a O
foundational O
mapping O
. O

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/09-02-2020-1210.8215v1.Empirical_tight_binding_parameters_for_GaAs_and_MgO_with_explicit_basis_through_DFT_mapping.pdf.json
A O
further O
shortcoming O
of O
traditional O
ETB O
is O
the O
lack O
of O
an O
explicit O
basis O
. O

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/09-02-2020-1210.8215v1.Empirical_tight_binding_parameters_for_GaAs_and_MgO_with_explicit_basis_through_DFT_mapping.pdf.json
In O
this O
work O
, O
a O
DFT O
mapping O
process O
which O
constructs O
TB O
parameters O
and O
explicit O
basis O
from O
DFT O
calculations O
is O
developed O

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/19-01-2019-paper-26.pdf.json

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/19-01-2019-paper-26.pdf.json

of O

id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/19-01-2019-paper-26.pdf.json

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/19-01-2019-paper-26.pdf.json

, O
such O

Ca2B5O9Cl O
by O
utilizing O
the O
mBJ O
approach O
is O
about O
0 O
. O
5 O
eV O
larger O
than O
that O
by O
utilizing O
the O
HSE06 O
functional O
. O

section 12
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/18-09-2019-paper-16.pdf.json

choose O
hybrid O

with O

parameters O
( O

= O
0 O
. O
25 O
, O

= O
0 O
. O
2 O

in O
the O
calculation O
scheme O
by O

the O

and O

for O

, O

, O

parameters O

to O

initio O
study O
of O
hot O
electrons O
in O
GaAs B-MATERIAL

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/04-09-2019-paper-25.pdf.json
Hot O
carrier O
dynamics O
critically O
impacts O
the O
performance O
of O
electronic O
, O
optoelectronic O
, O
photovoltaic O
, O
and O
plasmonic O
devices O
. O

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/04-09-2019-paper-25.pdf.json
Hot O
carriers O
lose O
energy O
over O
nanometer O
lengths O
and O
picosecond O
timescales O
and O
thus O
are O
challenging O
to O
study O
experimentally O
, O
whereas O
calculations O
of O
hot O
carrier O
dynamics O
are O
cumbersome O
and O
dominated O
by O
empirical O
approaches O
. O

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/04-09-2019-paper-25.pdf.json
In O
this O
work O
, O
we O
present O
ab O
initio O
calculations O
of O
hot O
electrons O
in O
gallium O
arsenide O
( O
GaAs B-MATERIAL
) O
using O
density O
functional O
theory O
and O
many O
- O
body O
perturbation O
theory O
. O

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/04-09-2019-paper-25.pdf.json
Our O
computed O
electron–phonon O
relaxation O
times O
at O
the O
onset O
of O
the O
Γ O
, O
L O
, O
and O
X O
valleys O
are O
in O
excellent O
agreement O
with O
ultrafast O
optical O
experiments O
and O
show O
that O
the O
ultrafast O
( O
tens O
of O
femtoseconds O
) O
hot O
electron O
decay O
times O
observed O
experimentally O
arise O
from O
electron–phonon O
scattering O
. O

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/04-09-2019-paper-25.pdf.json
This O
result O
is O
an O
important O
advance O
to O
resolve O
a O

on O
hot O
electron O
cooling O
in O
GaAs B-MATERIAL
. O

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/04-09-2019-paper-25.pdf.json
We O
further O
find O
that O
, O
contrary O
to O
common O
notions O
, O
all O
optical O
and O
acoustic O
modes O
contribute O
substantially O
to O
electron–phonon O
scattering O
, O
with O
a O
dominant O
contribution O
from O
transverse O
acoustic O
modes O
. O

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/04-09-2019-paper-25.pdf.json

work O

insight O
into O

section 4
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/26-08-2019-paper-12.pdf.json
It O
is O
interesting O
to O
note O
that O
the O
calculated O
zone O
- O
centered O
frequencies O
and O
the O
phonon O
dispersion O
up O
to O
5 O
GPa O
along O
different O
directions O
do O
not O
show O
any O
softening O
under O
pressure O
, O
reflecting O
the O
dynamic O
stability O
of O
marcasite B-STRUCTURE
FeS2 B-MATERIAL
up O
to O
5 O
GPa O
. O

section 4
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/26-08-2019-paper-12.pdf.json
A O
discussion O
of O
the O
marcasite B-STRUCTURE
- O
to O
- O
pyrite O
structural O
transition O
is O
presented O
based O
on O
a O
detailed O
comparison O
of O
the O
geometry O
and O
energetics O
of O
the O
two O
structures O
. O

section 4
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/26-08-2019-paper-12.pdf.json
We O
have O
also O
calculated O
the O
electronic O
band O
gap O
using O
semilocal O
exchange-correlation O
functional O
TB O
- O
mBJ O
and O
found O
that O
both O
polymorphic O
structures O
are O
indirect O
band O
gap O
semiconductors O
. O

section 4
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/26-08-2019-paper-12.pdf.json
Finally O
, O
we O
have O
calculated O
thermoelectric O
properties O
and O
find O
that O
the O
thermopower O
for O
the O
high O
- O
pressure O
phase O
is O
relatively O
higher O
than O
that O
for O
the O
ambient O
phase O
. O

section 4
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/26-08-2019-paper-12.pdf.json
We O
also O
predict O
that O
marcasite B-STRUCTURE
can O
be O
used O
for O
low O
- O
temperature O
thermoelectric O
applications O
, O
whereas O
pyrite O
can O
be O
used O
for O
the O
high O
- O
temperature O
applications O
. O

section 4
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/test/26-08-2019-paper-12.pdf.json
We O
hope O
that O
our O
work O
on O
the O
transport O
properties O
will O
further O
stimulate O
the O
experimentalists O
for O
a O
detailed O
study O
of O
the O
thermoelectric O
properties O
of O
this O
interesting O
mineral O
. O
